posts.caption_snippet:
The mind and body work together to keep your nervous system balanced, but stress, anxiety, and trauma can throw it off — leading to sleep issues, chronic pain, and emotional overwhelm.

The good news:
The pressure to reinvent yourself every January can do more harm than good. You don’t need a “new you” to grow. You just need support, intention, and habits that actually feel doable this season.

If you’re struggling with your mental health, it doesn’t have to get worse before you do something about it. Charlie Health’s intensive outpatient programs are designed for people who need more than o

Tired of hearing ‘new year, new me’? Us too.

The pressure to completely reinvent ourselves when the clock strikes midnight on New Year’s can feel overwhelming and unrealistic. Real change starts with
“Just kidding” is not a free pass to disrespect you. If the joke makes you feel small, embarrassed, or dismissed, it isn’t a joke. Your feelings matter.
As the year comes to a close, no matter where you are in your journey, we’re proud of you.
Stop scrolling and take a breathing break with us. Swipe to learn how to do box breathing, and save this for if you need a moment of calm in the future.

Have you ever blurted out something deeply personal and thought, “Why did I say all that?”

Oversharing can sometimes be a trauma response, especially for those who’ve felt unsafe or unseen.

Watch to
“All my exes were crazy” 🚩
When seasonal affective disorder (SAD) hits, even small comforts can make a difference. Here are a few things that can help you cope with SAD while caring for yourself this winter.
